TextLibrary.Text: Lord Bane
It's over, Bane. You're through.
It's over, Bane. You're through.
It's over, Bane. You're through.
It's over, Bane. You're through.
So you say. But in a hundred years, I will rise up again, and I will visit such destruction upon you and your heirs that history will forget you ever existed.
So you say. But in a hundred years, I will rise up again, and I will visit such destruction upon you and your heirs that history will forget you ever existed.
So you say. But in a hundred years, I will rise up again, and I will visit such destruction upon you and your heirs that history will forget you ever existed.
So you say. But in a hundred years, I will rise up again, and I will visit such destruction upon you and your heirs that history will forget you ever existed.
Not this time.
Not this time.
Not this time.
Not this time.
What do you mean, 'not this time'?
What do you mean, 'not this time'?
What do you mean, 'not this time'?
What do you mean, 'not this time'?

Lord Sartek, the God of the Minotaurs is on his way here even as we speak. He has a score to settle with you - something about being carved up into 101 pieces, I believe. I think he plans to give you a chance to experience the pain of that for yourself.

No. You cannot do that! Noooooooooooo............
